div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OwsYgb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Weekday meal deliveries: Starting the week of April 6, 2020, we will be moving to three delivery days each week. We are still delivering five days worth of meals – on Monday and Wednesday, we will do double drops. We will do a single drop on Fridays. Please remember social distancing – when waiting for meal pickup, it’s very important to make sure you’re standing 6 feet away from others. When picking up food, you may want to bring a bag to more easily transport food home.

South 2: HGF, Southside, MHS
East 1: Beech, GA, Weston, MCL, MHS,
East 2: Wilson, McDonough, Hallsville, Jewett, Southside, MHS
West 1: NW, Parkside, WHS
West 2: PV, Gossler, Parkside, WHS

div.p: Board of School Committee Meetings: To submit items/comments to be read aloud during the Public Forum portion of the agenda, please make sure that the letter or email you submit is 3 Minutes or less (which equals approximately 400 words) and submit it to: publiccomment@mansd.org. Click here for the Full Board Agendas

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, A Look Back at 2019

h1.div: A Look Back on 2019 at Manchester School District

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-Clt0zb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Earn While You Learn! Our innovative program allows you to earn a degree and teacher certification on the job and potentially even earn a paycheck! Southern New Hampshire University has partnered with the Manchester School District to create affordable pathways for teacher certification.
Anyone with a high school diploma or greater qualifies, and those with prior college coursework could be certified in two years or less!
Take the next step in your career. Many students could earn their degree with no tuition debt!
Contact Kathleen Carey for more information (k.carey1@snhu.edu | 603-626-9100 x 2597)

img.alt: 7th Annual AP District Honor Roll Recipient

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.small: This distinction recognizes that since 2014, Manchester has increased the number of students participating in Advanced Placement courses. Reaching these goals shows that Manchester is successfully identifying motivated, academically prepared students who are ready for Advanced Placement.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.small: Khan Academy offers a FREE official SAT practice test. Practice online - anywhere, anytime! https://www.khanacademy.org/sat

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

a.strong: EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES: teachers, paraprofessionals, substitutes, and more!
Create a SchoolMessenger account to set notification preferences

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Sign up for Nixle now - it's free! Receive SMS text alerts about weather closures & important district announcements

div.p: Click here to update you SchoolMessenger Preferences

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: The Manchester Academic Standards represent the highest level of academic expectations for all students in the Manchester School District. Please visit the Manchester School District curriculum web site to view the standards : http://curriculum.mansd.org/manchester-academic-standards

div.small: MSD is actively working to increase the accessibility and usability of its website. If you wish to report an issue or suggestion related to the accessibility of any content on our website, please use the feedback link on the home page.
It is the policy of the Manchester Board of School Committee, in its actions, and those of its employees, that there shall be no
discrimination on the basis of age, sex, race, color, marital status, physical or mental disability, religious creed, national origin
or sexual orientation for employment in, or operation and administration of any program or activity in the Manchester School
District. The Title IX Coordinator is Sherri Nichols for staff; the 504 and Title IX Coordinator is Mary Steady for students.
Please see above for contact information.
